column2: Formulate an ontology related to region. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/region#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Region rdf:type rdfs:Class .:Country rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region .:State rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region .:City rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region .:locatedIn rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range :Region .:hasCapital rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range :City .:CountryName rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range xsd:string .:StateName rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :State ;    rdfs:range xsd:string .:CityName rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :City ;    rdfs:range xsd:string .:Population rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range xsd:integer .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: region. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix geo: <http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Region a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Region" ;    rdfs:comment "A geographic area defined by certain boundaries or attributes." .:Country a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:comment "A sovereign state or territory, recognized as an independent nation." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region .:State a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "State" ;    rdfs:comment "A political division within a country, often with its own local government." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region .:City a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:comment "An urban area with a large population and particular administrative importance." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region .:Province a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Province" ;    rdfs:comment "A territorial unit, almost always an administrative division, within a country or state." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region .:Boundary a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Boundary" ;    rdfs:comment "A defined line that marks the limits of an area." .:hasBoundary a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "has boundary" ;    rdfs:comment "Associates a region with its boundary." ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range :Boundary .:locatedIn a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "located in" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies that a region is located within another region." ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range :Region .:hasCapital a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "has capital" ;    rdfs:comment "Associates a region with its capital city." ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range :City .:hasPopulation a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "has population" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies the population count of a region." ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range xsd:integer .:Area a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "area" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies the total land or sea area of a region." ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range xsd:float .:regionCode a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "region code" ;    rdfs:comment "An identifier for a region, potentially an ISO or other standardized code." ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range xsd:string .:WeatherCondition a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Weather Condition" ;    rdfs:comment "Describes the common weather conditions of a region." .:hasWeatherCondition a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "has weather condition" ;    rdfs:comment "Associates a region with its typical weather condition." ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range :WeatherCondition .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: region.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Region a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Region" ;    rdfs:comment "A geographical area defined by physical, political, or cultural boundaries." .:Country a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory." .:State a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "State" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region ;    rdfs:comment "An area within a country or a federal union." .:City a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region ;    rdfs:comment "A large and significant town or urban area, typically with its own local government." .:Province a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Province" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Region ;    rdfs:comment "A principal administrative division of certain countries." .:LocatedIn a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "located in" ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range :Region ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that one region is located within another." .:hasCapital a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has capital" ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range :City ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a country to its capital city." .```
